page.title: 05FAMOUS CONVALESCENT HOME
page.content: {The Miners'Convalescent Home,Bispham} This majestic building,dominating the coastline, was founded by miners' contributions for the use of miners in Western England and was opened by the Prince of Wales in 1927. It merged in 1977 to become the Lancashire and North Staffordshire home. The home, on a seven-acre site,has 110 spacious rooms,all with washing facilities, and caters for 155 residents. Although most are retired, priority is given to working miners;paraplegic residents are catered for in three specially built bungalows. Contributions from working miners finance the home, and each pit has a "bed allocation". The dedication of the nineteen live-in staff ensures a welcoming atmosphere.
